title: BBC Local Live: Herefordshire and Worcestershire on Friday 30 September - BBC News
summary: man taken to hospital after worcester city centre stabbing .
life sentence for evesham man who murdered his partner .
worcester lawyer jailed for attempted murder .
world heavyweight champion trains hopeful in redditch gym .

documents.title: political week in 60 seconds
text: political week in 60 seconds

documents.title: road closed by chemical tank leak
text: road closed by chemical tank leak

documents.title: man jailed for murdering partner
text: man jailed for murdering partner

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: watch : weather for tonight and the weekend
text: showers tending to die away this evening to leave dry and clear conditions for a time before further showers spread in from the southwest at the end of the night .
lows of 10c ( 50f ) .
you can read a full forecast on the bbc weather page .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: man jailed for life after he murdered his partner
text: a 51-year-old-man has been jailed for life after he pleaded guilty to murdering his partner .
mark pearce , of bewdley street evesham , was told by worcester crown court he would serve a minimum of 16-and-a-half years .
west mercia say pearce stabbed his partner once after `` a domestic argument '' .
pearce launched a brutal attack on his partner - this was an incident of domestic violence of the highest severity which sadly had tragic consequences for ms hitch . ''

documents.title: lawyer jailed over wife head stabbing
text: lawyer jailed over wife head stabbing

documents.title: well-known worcester tory funds the labour party in council payroll blunder
text: a leading conservative politician has become embroiled in an astonishing council blunder - after funds were diverted from her bank account to fund the labour party .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: watch : electric three-wheeler on sale in department store
text: an electric three-wheeler made by the morgan motor company , based in malvern , has gone on sale at a department store .
i 've been taking a look at the technology behind the car .
author: Peter Plisner
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: prosecutor jailed for stabbing wife
text: a lawyer who worked for the crown prosecution service in the west midlands has been jailed for six years after admitting attempting to murder his wife while depressed .

iain farrimond , 54 , of of battenhall road in worcester , failed to kill his wife tina of 28 years with a large kitchen knife , and then beat her with a wooden ornamental cat - only stopping the assault when she pleaded with him .
judge gregory dickinson , in sentencing `` loving and devoted husband '' farrimond at .
at nottingham crown court , described it as a sad case , committed while the attacker was `` in the grip of severe depressive illness '' .

documents.title: latest : life for man who murdered partner ; lawyer admits attempted murder charge ; city centre stabbing
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in herefordshire and worcestershire :
- man jailed for life after admitting murdering his partner after a domestic row
- former prosecutor with the crown prosecution service pleads guilty to the attempted murder of his wife while depressed
- man taken to hospital with a stab wound after being attacked in worcester city centre
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: breakingman taken to hospital after city centre stabbing
text: a man has been taken to hospital with a stab wound after being attacked in worcester city centre .
west midlands ambulance service says crews were called by the police at 15:21 to reports a man had been attacked in st nicholas street .

documents.title: big interview with paralympic gold medalist sascha kindred
text: paralympic golden boy sascha kindred will be speaking to british swimming next month to see if they think he has what it takes to compete in next year 's world championships .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: on air : the new electric morgan on sale in a department store
text: the worcestershire-based car-maker morgan is looking to make something of a fashion statement - it 's selling its first-ever electric cars not in a showroom but in selfridges department store .
you can find out more about the technology that lies behind the car on midland today at 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Peter Plisner
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: rugby : heathcote back for falcons game
text: here is the warriors ' squad for saturday 's home game against newcastle falcons - tom heathcote returns to the side at number 10 .
you can hear full commentary of the game on bbc hereford & worcester from 15:00 on saturday .
team news | @ twitterid returns for visit of newcastle @ twitterid this sunday .

documents.title: latest : attempted murder guilty plea : electric three-wheeler on sale ; champ trains boxer
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in herefordshire and worcestershire :
- a worcester lawyer who worked for the crown prosecution service for 23 years has pleaded guilty to attempted murder
- electric morgan goes on sale in department store
- world heavyweight champion trains hopeful in redditch gym
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: lawyer stabbed wife in the head when he was depressed
text: a court has heard how a senior court prosecutor with the crown prosecution service ( cps ) in birmingham stabbed his wife in the head as she slept after a bout of depression brought on by the pressures of work .

nottingham crown court heard that iain farrimond , 54 , told police immediately afterwards that he had intended his assault in the early hours of 26 may , the day before his wedding anniversary , to be the `` day of death '' .
farrimond , of battenhall road in worcester , who had penned a suicide note at the scene of the assault , admitted attempted murder .
the court was told that his wife , who suffered five stab wounds in the attack , had enjoyed a `` remarkably successful '' recovery from her physical injuries .
farrimond , who was dismissed from the cps following the incident , will be sentenced later .

documents.title: travel : advance notice of closure of hylton road in worcester
text: the road is being closed for the tour ride - a cycling event .
advance notice of closure of hylton road # worcester on sunday 9 oct from 2:00am until 12 noon for @ twitterid diversions via henwick road

documents.title: your pitch perfect
text: graeme keeble looks after the pitch at edgar street - he tweeted this of his handiwork ,
the pitch will stay in pristine condition as the bulls are playing away on saturday in the fa cup at tonbridge angels .
giving the old girl a feed !
@ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: lawyer pleads guilty to attempted murder
text: a lawyer has pleaded guilty to attempted murder .
iain farrimond , 53 , of battenhall road , worcester , worked for the crown prosecution service in birmingham for 23 years .
at nottingham crown court this afternoon he 's admitted stabbing a woman in worcester in may .
author: Michael Perkins
BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: on air : former world champion trains boxer at redditch gym
text: the two-time world heavyweight champion `` terrible '' tim witherspoon ( been training an up-and-coming british prospect at a gym in redditch .
solihull-born boxer kash ali is due to fight hari miles on saturday night .
you can find out more on midlands today at 18:30 on bbc one .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: new £ 200,000 eye unit opens at hospital
text: a new mobile £ 200,000 eye unit has begun treating patients at hereford county hospital .
it will help monitor and treat potentially blinding retinal diseases , including those that are age-related or caused by diabetes .
the funding has come from a trust set up in memory of the late geoffrey lewis of southend farm , mathon .

documents.title: fury as malvern is rocked by 500 fly-tipping incidents in just two years
text: more than 500 fly-tipping incidents have blighted malvern in just two years - leaving the taxpayer counting the cost of cleaning up the unsightly mess .
author: Evesham Journal

documents.title: supporters ' association elects new chairman
text: andrew jenkins , a lifelong supporter of worcestershire , was elected at the agm of the association after the previous chairman , ken mills , died following a long illness .
andrew jenkins has been elected as the new chairman of the worcestershire supporters ' association

documents.title: mother hails 'miracle ' recovery from coma
text: the mother of a herefordshire woman who has made a remarkable recovery after being left in a coma and on life support following a car crash says it 's nice to be able to see her daughter smile again .
doctors have said the fact that 22-year-old sam hemming , from credenhill , was so fit may have helped her survive and recover from her injuries .

carol hemming says the part of her daughter 's brain that looked after speech and walking died after the crash , but controlling those functions was taken over by another part of her brain , leading to a recovery that has shocked doctors .
she went to see her hereford doctor on monday and he told her you are not supposed to be alive , you are a miracle , [ after ] the injuries you sustained an everyday person would not have lived . ''

documents.title: watch : forecast for the afternoon , evening and the weekend
text: some showers which may turn heavy with the risk of hail and thunder .
breezy too , with the best of the brightness towards the end of the afternoon..
highs of 16c ( 61f ) .
you can read a full forecast on the the bbc weather page .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: your west midlands questions answered
text: your west midlands questions answered

documents.title: railway line at bromsgrove to close for 12 days
text: the line between the newly opened bromsgrove station at birmingham is to close for 12 days to allow it to be upgraded , network rail has announced .
the closure will start on 26 october .
network rail says the £ 100m project will see the line electrified and the signals upgraded .
buses will replace trains while the line is closed .

there is never a good time to close the railway for any length of time but we have looked at all options and worked with london midland and crosscountry to complete this work at a time which will cause least disruption to passengers . ''

documents.title: latest : abandoned in hospital corridor claim ; three-car crash injuries ; coma woman 's remarkable recovery
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in herefordshire and worcestershire :
- the family of a seriously ill redditch man say he was left in a hospital corridor for 21 hours without being taken to the toilet
- a teenage girl and a man in his 90s have been taken to hospital after a three-car crash
- doctors are studying the `` miraculous '' recovery of a young herefordshire woman who was seriously injured in a car crash
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: row over worcester 's cctv as city council agrees to earmark £ 80k on overhaul
text: an extra £ 80,000 is set to be sunk into worcester 's cctv cameras after fears about the poor condition many are in .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: 'patient told to wet himself ' during long wait in a & e
text: the family of a seriously ill redditch man have criticised the safety of the worcestershire royal hospital 's a & e department , since the transfer of some services from the alexandra in redditch .

michael , from churchill ( who did not want to give his surname to protect his family ) , says his brother-in-law was left in a corridor for 21 hours , after being admitted following a seizure , and was refused help going to the toilet .

he did want to go to the toilet and the nurse said 'i 'm awfully sorry we ca n't deal with it , he 'll just have to wet himself and we 'll deal with it later ' , which is a dreadful thing to say to someone . ''

the nhs trust that runs the hospital says while it ca n't comment on individual cases , staff always see patients based on clinical need , and that it 's unfortunate that patients sometimes wait much longer than they would wish , during busy times . ''

documents.title: weather : rain warning for saturday
text: there 's a yellow warning for heavy rain in herefordshire on saturday .
yellow warning of rain for west midlands : herefordshire valid from 0200 sat 01 oct to 1800 sat 01 oct

documents.title: your up close and personal with nature
text: this great photo comes from bbc weather watcher field basher .
i 'd love to feature your photos - you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .

documents.title: sexual assault on bus investigated
text: a woman has been sexually assaulted while travelling on a bus from winyates to redditch .
west mercia police say the assault happened just after 17:00 on tuesday 27 september .
a man walked from the back of the bus and sat next to a woman and touched her inappropriately several times before getting off the bus , a spokesman said .
we believe there were between 15-20 people on the bus at the time who may have important information that could help to locate the suspect . ''

documents.title: rugby : te'o named in england elite player squad
text: worcester warriors ' ben te'o has been named in eddie jones ' 45-man elite player squad .
the warriors ' centre is one of 37 players who will attend a three-day training camp in brighton .
england are preparing for test series against south africa , fiji , argentina and australia later in the year .

documents.title: travel : congestion on whittington road in worcester
text: an accident is causing slow traffic .
traffic congestion on b4084 whittington road # worcester following earlier accident

documents.title: coma woman : 'i ca n't remember anything '
text: a herefordshire woman who was left in a coma and on life support after a car crash says she ca n't remember anything about the accident .
sam hemming , who 's 22 and from credenhill , was left with brain injuries - doctors have described her recovery as `` a miracle '' .
the law graduate is now hoping to begin training as a solicitor in september next year .
i ca n't remember anything about the accident - i can remember graduating , but that 's about it . ''

documents.title: latest : coma woman 's 'miracle ' recovery : no dignity for a & e patient ; sexual assault on a bus
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in herefordshire and worcestershire :
- law graduate left in a coma and on life support after a car crash hopes to become a solicitor after her `` miracle '' recovery
- the family of a redditch man says he was treated without dignity or respect when he was told he 'd have to wet himself while waiting in a & e
- police appeal for witness after a woman is sexually assaulted on a bus
author: Kate West
Journalist, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: brother pays tribute to his 35-year-old sister after her 'tragic and unexpected ' death
text: the brother of a malvern woman who died earlier this month has made a heart-felt tribute to his sister .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: watch : why a seven-year-old wants you to fist pump for kidney disease
text: i 've been to meet seven-year-old aouran galbraith from hereford , who is urging people to start fist pumping to help him to raise awareness of his kidney disease .
he has pkd - polycystic kidney disease - which can make kidneys swell to up to four times their normal size and become up to 100 times heavier .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: attempted murder court appearance
text: a worcester lawyer is appearing in crown court later accused of attempted murder .
iain farrimond , 53 , who lives on battenhall road , is alleged to have stabbed a woman in worcester in may .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: woman left in coma after car crash hopes for full revovery
text: a herefordshire woman has returned home , months after doctors told her family they were only keeping her on life support so they could `` say goodbye '' .
sam hemming , who 's 22 and from credenhill , was travelling back to herefordshire from university when the car she was travelling in crashed .
she was left in a coma , with four broken bones in her neck , three open fractures on her arm and internal bleeding , but now hopes to make a full recovery .
i hope to be back to normal again - i 'm hoping by october i 'll be back walking for my sister 's birthday , so i do n't have to use a frame or anything .
hopefully by christmas i 'll be fully healed . ''

documents.title: latest : miracle recovery after car crash ; attempted murder court appearance ; family shock at lack of hospital care
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in herefordshire and worcestershire :
- woman kept on life support after car crash makes miraculous recovery
- a worcester lawyer is appearing in crown court later accused of attempted murder
- the family of a redditch man say he was told to wet himself while in hospital as there was no-one to take him to the toilet
author: Kate West
Journalist, BBC Hereford & Worcester

everyone is getting out and walking around it 's odd

hard to be more descriptive than that tbh haha

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for herefordshire and worcestershire have finished for the day but local stories and traffic updates will be added automatically through the night .
we 'll be back from 08:00 on friday with more live news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: delays of an hour on m5
text: normal conditions on the m5 are n't expected to return until at least 19:15 , traffic england .
says .
diversions are in place and delays are currently running at about 60 minutes .
# m5 remains closed btwn j6 # worcester and j5 n/b where 2 lorries have collided and agricultural equipment has been shed blocking the road
lanes through roadworks are too narrow .
better have 2 rather than 3 ?
way way to many accidents in this stretch !

documents.title: m5 congestion back to j8
text: congestion northbound on the m5 is now backing up to j8 , we understand , and is not expected to improve anytime soon .
diversions are in place via the m6 j6 exit , but commuter traffic , coupled with a big clean-up operation , mean problems could remain for some time .
author: BBC Travel

text: feeling fresh on friday , but with widespread sunny spells and continued scattered showers , perhaps heavy or thundery towards the north .
lows overnight of 11c ( 52f ) .

BBC Weather

documents.title: eastham bridge rebuild : residents welcome news that construction is to begin
text: news that work will start next month rebuilding eastham bridge , which collapsed into the river teme , has been welcomed by local residents .
they 've faced 10 miles ( 16km ) of diversions since may , when the 18th century grade ii listed bridge collapsed .
worcestershire county council say the work should be finished by april next year .
we 're glad that there 's a timeline and we know that in two to three weeks we 'll see the machinery back down at the bridge and activity starting . ''

documents.title: m5 blocked after vehicle overturns
text: emergency services responding to crash on the m5 between j6 ( worcester ) and j5 ( droitwich ) have a job on their hands with reports one of the two lorries has overturned and caused a spill .
it is so far unclear if other vehicles are involved .
# m5 northbound between j6 and j5 | overturned vehicle

documents.title: long tailbacks building on m5
text: long tailbacks building on the m5 now near j5 .
rush-hour traffic will only make this worse .
a crash involving two lorries seems to be the cause .
very heavy traffic at junction 5 of the nbound m5 following a collision involving 2 lorries .
1 patient with minor injuries .
avoid the area .

documents.title: travel : major congestion on the m5 northbound
text: all three lanes are blocked between j6 ( worcester north ) and j5 ( droitwich ) - the fire service say a lorry has shed its load of agricultural equipment .
more from bbc travel .
major congestion # m5 northbound junctions 6-5 , avoid if possible .
rtc involving lorry carrying agricultural equipment .
can you confirm full closure ?

text: this week 's malvern gazette looks at the number of fly-tipping incidents in the area .
author: Malvern Gazette

documents.title: baby in coffee shop gets unexpected role in bronte film
text: a baby in a coffee shop has saved the day for a film company who were shooting a new version of wuthering heights in the old house musuem in hereford .
the baby who was due to be filmed got stuck in birmingham , but the actor playing heathcliff went into a nearby coffee shop and appealed for a stand-in .
antoinette sullivan , who was there with baby izabelle , stepped into the breach , and the three-week old will now have a starring role , even if she has no lines .
the production , being made by three hedgehogs films , will be filming at hampton court in herefordshire next week .
the grateful company have given izabelle a free photoshoot at their studios , as a thank you .

documents.title: latest : bridge rebuild date set ; jobs threat at distribution company : baby becomes stand-in film star

- local residents who 've faced long diversions since the eastham bridge collapsed have welcomed news rebuilding is about to start
- a worcester distribution centre for a national plumbing and heating business is being considered for closure
- coffee shop baby saves the day for film company shooting emily bronte classic in hereford
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

text: if you travel from bromsgrove , hereford or worcester there 'll by timetable changes from 25 october .

please check before you travel .
yes - thanks for even more # misery to look forward to

documents.title: curfew given to man arrested for carrying knife near school
text: a 53-year-old man , who was arrested after he was spotted carrying a knife near a frankley school , pleaded guilty to possessing a knife in a public place yesterday afternoon .
author: Redditch Advertiser

documents.title: netball : professional team sign up 'local talent '
text: worcester 's professional netball side , the severn stars , have added two local players to their squad .

university of worcester third-year student rebecca tildesley ( left ) and lauren brooks ( right ) join superleague signings becky oatley and sophie carter alongside england trio eleanor cardwell , jodie gibson and laura malcolm .
20-year-old tildsley has played for the england under-17 and under-21 teams .
brooks , who 's 22 , has played for the england under-17s and under-19s .

documents.title: your malvern seen from a helicopter
text: gen archer is a helicopter pilot , and also a former pupil of malvern st james school - she took these from high above the town where she spent her schooldays .
i 'd love to feature your photos - you do n't even have to go up in a helicopter - you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .

documents.title: alexandra hospital : 'it will be there for many years to come ' promises mp
text: the mp for redditch says the town 's hospital will be there `` for many years to come '' , despite cutbacks in the services it offers .
karen lumbley organised a public meeting last night where hundreds of local people expressed their anger at the way the alexandra hospital is being run .
six years ago two of the options on the table were that there would n't be a hospital at all - the alex is still there and will still be there for many years to come .
the services are not safe there , which is why there are temporary closures of the wards . ''

documents.title: latest : new bridge by april ; threat to distribution centre ; more public input on hospital changes
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in herefordshire and worcestershire :
- a bridge that collapsed leaving locals with a 10-mile ( 16km ) commute to their local village , will be replaced by next april
- a worcester distribution centre for a national plumbing and heating business is being considered for closure
-the trust that runs worcestershire 's hospitals promises more public consultations about the future of the alexandra in redditch

documents.title: netball : severn stars sign two more players
text: worcester 's professional netball side , the severn stars , have signed another two players to their squad .
the club , which is jointly run by the universities of worcester and gloucestershire , has signed becky oatley and sophie carter , who both currently play in the superleague .
oatley , who 's 31 , has three caps for wales and played last year in the superleague for celtic dragons .
20-year-old carter has played for the england under-19s , and has been with last year 's superleague semi-finalists , the hertfordshire mavericks , since 2014 .

highs of 17c ( 63f ) .

BBC Weather

documents.title: eastham bridge : new bridge will include some original elements
text: the replacement for eastham bridge , which collapsed in may , will not be `` a like for like replacement '' for the 18th century original , the council says .
the grade ii listed structure collapsed into the river teme after fast flowing water undermined its piers .

the new bridge that we will be building can not be a like for like replacement for the old , listed bridge , but it will include some of the original elements of the old bridge and most importantly will get people moving across the river as quickly as possible . ''
more on midlands today at 13:30 on bbc one .

documents.title: kidderminster shuttle back page : gardiner wants fa cup success
text: harriers coach matt gardiner has challenged his players to carry their league form into this saturday 's fa cup clash at lancaster city .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: latest : bridge rebuild date ; 140 jobs under threat ; more talks on hospital 's future
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in herefordshire and worcestershire :
- rebuilding work on collapsed 18th century bridge in worcestershire to begin next month
- a distribution centre in worcester could be closed with the loss of around 140 jobs
- hospitals trust promises more discussions with the public about the future of the alexandra in redditch
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: work to start on collapsed bridge
text: work to start on collapsed bridge

documents.title: watch : angry patients at a hospital meeting
text: patients and a former consultant at the alexandra hospital in redditch make their points at a public meeting about the future of the hospital .
author: Matthew Bone
Political reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: mp talks to company over threat to jobs at distribution centre
text: the mp for worcester , robin walker , says he has spoken to a national plumbing and heating supplier about the threat to their distribution centre in worcester .
wolseley uk say they are considering shutting the site as part of restructuring plans .
mr walker says he 's been told around 140 employees would be affected but he has asked the company to consider keeping the centre open .

i said to wolseley that i hope they do n't take the decision to close their site , but if they do i want to make sure they are linking up with the county council and city council to make sure there is new employment being created and that as many people are relocated to their other sites , if that 's what they want . ''

documents.title: eastham bridge : temporary bridge would have needed environmental impact survey
text: a temporary bridge to replace the 18th century structure which collapsed into the river teme would not have been practical as it would have needed a full environmental impact survey , the council says .

worcestershire county council says eastham bridge , near tenbury wells , is in a site of special scientific interest ( sssi ) and building a temporary bridge could not have gone ahead without the survey .
local residents have complained they 've been forced to take long diversions since the bridge collapsed in may .

we recognise the significance this bridge has on the lives and livelihoods of people in the area , which is why we have made every effort to come up with the best , long term solution as quickly as possible . ''

documents.title: alexandra hospital : facts and figures
text: hundreds of people packed a public meeting about the future of the alexandra hospital last night .

documents.title: latest : date set for historic bridge rebuild ; anger at hospital meeting ; jobs threat at distribution centre
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in herefordshire and worcestershire :
- work to rebuild a collapsed 18th century bridge over the river teme in worcestershire will begin next month
- the mp for redditch and health bosses came under fire at a public meeting about the future of the alexandra hospital
threat to 140 jobs at a worcester distribution centre for one of the country 's biggest plumbing and heating suppliers
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: hereford times front page : miracles happen
text: this week 's hereford times has the story of a patient on life-support who made an amazing recovery .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: west mercia 'looking at options ' over body cameras
text: researchers say police body-cams are working .
the cambridge university study showed complaints by members of the public against officers fell by 93 % over 12 months compared with the year before .
almost 2,000 officers across four uk forces and two us police departments were monitored for the project .
west mercia police do n't routinely use them , but the force says it 's `` looking at its options '' .

documents.title: breakingconstruction work to begin on collapsed bridge next month
text: construction work to permanently replace eastham bridge , which collapsed into the river teme in may , is to begin next month , the council says .

worcestershire county council says it has been working closely with specialist contractors and the environment agency , historic england , natural england and malvern hills district council to decide the best way to rebuild the grade ii listed bridge .
the new bridge can not be a `` like for like '' copy of the 18th century original , the council says - it collapsed after fast-moving water undermined its piers .
the bridge will be operational by april next year , a spokesman says .

documents.title: riba stirling prize shortlist 2016 : the outhouse , forest of dean
text: riba stirling prize shortlist 2016 : the outhouse , forest of dean

documents.title: alexandra hospital : key dates
text: there were angry scenes at a public meeting to discuss the future of the alexandra hospital in redditch and the other hospitals in worcestershire .
here are some of the key dates in the long-running saga of the hospitals ' future :
- january 2013 : talks about birmingham trusts running the alexandra hospital
- february 2013 : proposal to downgrade a & e at the alexandra hospital as part of a review of services by the worcestershire acute hospitals nhs trust ( waht )
- january 2014 : independent review says a & e should stay at the alexandra
- february 2015 - the entire team of four consultants running a & e services at the alexandra resigns
- december 2015 : waht rated inadequate after an inspection by the health watchdog , the care quality commission
- june 2016 : paediatrics moved from alexandra hospital on a `` temporary '' basis

documents.title: campaign launched against 'sham ' stourport stables plan
text: angry stourport people have launched a fight against a `` sham '' planning application they fear is a first step towards converting farm land into a huge housing development .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: alexandra hospital meeting : former consultant hits out
text: a former consultant at the alexandra hospital in redditch , dr santi vathenen , returned from west sussex to hit out at his former bosses .
hundreds of protestors took part in a rally and public meeting in redditch last night about the running of worcestershire 's hospitals .
at the meeting , dr vathenen attacked the way services are being moved away from the alexandra .
making [ the alexandra hospital ] work as a part-time , run-down hospital with some services missing is not an option .
you ca n't have acute medicine at the alexandra hospital without surgery , without gynaecology , without these services . ''
chris tidman , the interim chief executive of the trust which runs the alex and the worcestershire royal , says moving services will not put patients ' lives in danger .

we had [ these kind of concerns ] 12 or 13 years ago at kidderminster , there were lots of concerns about what will happen with a 30 minute drive to worcester , but all the evidence shows once you dial 999 an ambulance you up and you are in good hands . ''
author: Matthew Bone
Political reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: jobs threat at distribution centre
text: the worcester distribution centre of a major uk plumbing and heating supplier is under threat .
wolseley uk say they are reviewing the future of their site on the berkeley business park as part of plans to restructure the company .
they say the review is likely to see a reduction in staff and branch closures .

the videos are part of a wider promoting redditch initiative which aims to change residents ' perceptions of the borough and attract new businesses to the area .
as we go about our daily routines we sometimes forget to take a step back and revel in what redditch has to offer . ''

if you stand there and look east , the next highest hills are the urals in russia .

documents.title: attempted robbery of woman in her car
text: two men have tried to rob woman in her 60s as she sat in her car , police say .
west mercia police the incident took place in melen street in redditch between 21:30 and 21:45 last night
the two men entered a silver peugeot and demanded money from the woman .

documents.title: watch : police catch hgv driver on mobile
text: the driver of a 44-tonne truck was among motorists caught using their mobile phone as the bbc joined central motorway police on patrol .
it comes as data shows the number of motorists stopped across the country has almost halved in five years .
the national police federation said the drop was due to fewer traffic officers .
under new rules expected to come in next year , drivers will get six points on their licence and face a £ 200 fine .

documents.title: you getting schools closer to wildlife
text: worcestershire wildlife trust looks after more than 75 nature reserves in the county .
the knapp and papermill reserve is near alfrick - the dipping platform will allow school children to get closer to the pondlife in safety .
pond restoration at # knappandpapermill ( & new dipping platform for schools ) @ twitterid lkg frwd to dragonflies , amphibs etc in spring
great work # greenheroes !
thank you : )

documents.title: sas artwork : the regiment 's links to hereford
text: a new artwork marking the special relationship between the sas and the city of hereford is to be installed in hereford cathedral .
the regiment has been based in the city for 57 years .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: watch : solid start to season says wolves head coach
text: worcester wolves ' head coach , paul james , says a win over sheffield sharks on friday would represent a solid start to their bbl championship season .
the wolves beat cheshire phoenix in overtime in their opening game of the season before going down 77-66 at pre-season favourites leicester riders in a game in which they led into the final quarter .
james says two wins from three against three very solid teams would leave them in good shape as they head into a two-week mini-break in their fixtures .
they do n't play again until friday , 14 october when glasgow rocks are due at the university of worcester arena .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

send us your questions here .
we could be in touch and your question could make the news .

documents.title: cricket : new captain leach pays tribute to mitchell
text: all-rounder joe leach is the new captain of worcestershire , after batsmen daryl mitchell was `` relieved of his duties '' after six years .
leach has been vice-captain for the past 12 months .
the all-rounder , who 's taken 65 wickets and scored almost 600 runs in the championship this season , says being made captain is a `` great honour '' .
i would like to pay tribute to daryl who has done a fantastic job , got us two promotions and to quarter-finals , and i look forward to working with him as a senior player . ''

documents.title: cricket : mitchell 'deeply hurt ' by the decision to drop him as captain
text: daryl mitchell says being sacked as captain at worcestershire has come as `` devastating news '' .
in a statement on social media he says he is `` bitterly disappointed and left deeply hurt by the decision '' .
he admits to having poor form at the start of the season and that he has n't `` been at his best as captain in certain parts of the year '' .
the club offered him the chance to resign but mitchell says he is not `` a quitter '' .
he thanks steve rhodes , staff , players and supporters at the club and say he will give his `` full backing '' to new captain joe leach .
an open letter to members , supporters and media .
sad to hear that mitch , you are a credit to @ twitterid
all our best wishes from norton .
your commitment , quality & class have always shone through .
we know you 'll bounce back .
you 're a proven leader .
those qualities will continue to shine through .
u would not be the 1st to be reappointed at a later date .
used as a complete scapegoat mike bumpy must be made of teflon
as always , a nice straight bat from you .
i hope you 'll stay at worcester for the rest of your career & many more 1000+ seasons .
you 've done a great job with a young developing side , loads of runs left in the tank , hopefully it 's still for the pears !
stick with us mitch , and prove them wrong .
turned poor team into a half decent side in 6 years as captain .
terrible decision worcester politics will never change # teammitch
good luck for 2017 and thank you for all you have done for the club and will do in the future .
# coyp

fully hoping to still see you playing at new road next season
its the coaches who need moving on shocking daryl has cared the team last few seasons
excellent 6 years , i part agree & part do n't .
things have become stale and you need to move on & at times bumpy covers his back

i 'd have him in a flash at yorkshire !

documents.title: fewer drivers caught using mobile phones : west mercia statistics
text: the number of drivers caught using a mobile phone behind the wheel has almost halved in five years , the bbc can reveal .
some 178,000 people were stopped in 2011-12 by police in the uk , compared with under 95,000 last year .
the national police federation said the drop was due to fewer traffic officers .
here are some of the figures for west mercia police .
however , the number of drivers attending a road safety course shot up from 481 five years ago , to 2,121 last year .

documents.title: your questions : where does hereford get its name ?
text: chris page used your questions to ask : `` where did the name of hereford come from ? ''
`` quite simply , it means army ford from the old english , '' said rhys griffith , senior archivist at herefordshire archive and records centre .
`` the anglo saxon for army is here .
`` it is likely that hereford had emerged as an anglo-saxon ecclesiastical centre and a military frontier settlement by the end of the 8th century . ''

documents.title: murdered police officer remembered 60 years after his death
text: the family , friends and former colleagues of a herefordshire police officer have been honouring him 60 years after his death .
sgt brian carter was shot and killed while he was serving with the un police unit in cyprus .
a special memorial evening was held at st michael and all angels in lyonshall .

Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: sas stained glass memorial for cathedral
text: a new artwork marking the special relationship between the elite sas regiment and hereford is set to be installed at the city 's cathedral .
it will be 9m ( 30ft ) high , will cost £ 1m and includes 3,000 pieces of glass in 40 colours .
it 's being funded through donations by the sas regimental association and will be installed in april .

documents.title: breakingcricket : worcestershire captain 'relieved of his duties '
text: worcestershire has announced that captain daryl mitchell has been `` relieved of his duties '' .
the 32-year-old opening batsman has been captain at the club for six years .
worcestershire director of cricket steve rhodes said the two had gone through `` lots of ups and downs `` and feels for the team to go forward it needed `` a fresh start '' .
he said he hopes mitchell can continue to play `` a key role '' as a batsman .
although i disagree with [ steve rhodes ] decision , i do fully respect it and know it has been made with the very best intentions for worcestershire ccc moving forward . ''

documents.title: latest : alexandra hospital claims ; sas artwork for cathedral ; fewer drivers caught using mobiles

- birmingham hospital trust suggests it would keep some emergency services at the alexandra in redditch if it was running things
- a specially designed piece of art is being installed at hereford cathedral to mark the relationship between the city and the sas
- fall in the number of people being caught using mobiles while driving blamed on cuts to traffic officer numbers
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: alexandra hospital changes : 'all about patient safety not money '
text: the trust running hospitals in worcester has rejected suggestions that services at the alexandra in redditch could have been maintained if it was run from birmingham .
a letter from university hospitals birmingham criticised plans to move services out of redditch , saying they could have stayed in the town if it has been allowed to run the hospital ,
chris tidman , the interim chief executive of the worcestershire acute hospitals nhs trust ( waht ) , says there have been three independent clinical reviews into the changes .
the reason we 're looking to make these changes is about patient safety - as a board we 're listening to what our doctors have said and it 's about making our service safe and sustainable .
[ campaigners ] say this is all about money - it 's not about money at all . ''
author: Matthew Bone
Political reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: parent who tweeted about 'outrageous ' after-school club charges threatened with legal action
text: a head teacher has been accused of bullying after threatening a parent with legal action when he openly criticised school policy .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: alexandra changes putting 'significant pressure ' on birmingham hospitals
text: the trust running birmingham 's hospitals say some of their services are under `` significant pressure '' because of the increase in patients being sent to them from north worcestershire , instead of going to the hospital in worcester .

hereford and worcester has seen a letter from university hospitals birmingham which criticises plans to move some services out of redditch , saying they could have stayed in the town if they 'd been allowed to run the hospital .
nhs managers want to permanently move some a & e , maternity and childrens services from redditch to worcester - these plans are going to consultation in november .
this letter from the trust running hospitals in birmingham questions the plan , and says it could have taken over the alexandra hospital and possibly kept some services there .
author: Matthew Bone
Political reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: police cuts blamed for fall in prosecutions
text: cuts to policing are being blamed for a fall in the number of people caught using their phones while driving .
the police federation says the deployment of fewer traffic officers has made it easier to avoid being prosecuted .
last year the number of people caught in west mercia fell by a quarter to 2,300 .
if we have less officers to enforce , of course we 're going to have less prosecutions . ''

documents.title: searches for an unsung sporting hero in the west midlands

it could be the man who washes the kits or the manager of your local youth side - but it has to be someone who goes above and beyond and deserves some recognition .
do you know a local sports volunteer who deserves some much-needed recognition ?
it 's time to let us know .

documents.title: birmingham trust says it could have taken over worcestershire hospital
text: the trust running birmingham 's hospitals has suggested it could have stepped in to keep some emergency services at the alexandra in redditch if it had been allowed to take over the hospital .

hereford & worcester has seen a letter from university hospitals birmingham which criticises plans to move some services out of redditch , saying changes there have already led to a 17 % increase in patients travelling to birmingham for emergency treatment .
nhs managers want to permanently move some a & e , maternity and childrens ' services from redditch to worcester - in the face of fierce opposition from a campaign group .
the letter from the trust running hospitals in birmingham suggests there was another option - to allow it to take over redditch and possibly keep some services there .
but letting a birmingham trust take over the alexandra hospital would probably create big financial problems for the rest of worcestershire .
author: Matthew Bone
Political reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: two arrested following nightclub assault
text: two men needed hospital treatment after an assault at a nightclub , police say .
west mercia police say the two men , aged 20 and 29 , received facial injuries after a `` verbal and physical altercation '' in the outside smoking area at sin night club , new road , worcester .
officers are appealing for witnesses to the incident , which happened at about 23:45 on saturday , 24 september .
a 20-year old man from london and a 29-year old man from malvern have been arrested on sus of assault and bailed until 21 october , a spokesman said .

documents.title: be on the lookout for a new type of bee
text: a wildlife trust is asking people to be on the lookout for a species of bee that is slowly making its way northward through the uk .
the ivy bee , which lives and breeds in underground chambers , was only discovered by scientists in 1993 .
worcestershire wildlife trust says colonies of the bee have been found in the northwick area of worcester .
before 1993 nobody in the world knew about these little chaps - in 2001 they hopped over the channel and came to britain , where they have slowly spread north .
they are incredibly new to worcestershire . ''

the raid took place on cranham drive in warndon and the two 30-year-olds and a 31-year-old were released on bail until the 24 october , police say .

author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: memorial evening for herefordshire police officer killed while serving with the un
text: the friends , family and former colleagues of a herefordshire police officer who was murdered whilst serving in cyprus will gather in lyonshall tonight to remember him .
sgt hugh carter , of the herefordshire constabulary , was shot and killed 60 years ago this week whilst he serving with the united kingdom police unit in cyprus - he was only 25 years old .
his brother joe , a former police inspector , will be paying tribute to hugh in tonight 's special memorial evening at the church of st michael and all angels .
the evening has been organised by the police role of honour trust .

documents.title: cricket : fastest hundred award for worcestershire batsman
text: worcestershire tom kohler-cadmore won the walter lawrence trophy for scoring the fastest hundred of the 2016 domestic season .
the batsman lifted the award for his 43-ball century in the rapids opening natwest t20 blast fixture of the summer against durham jets at new road .

documents.title: your civil war museum in the sun
text: the commandery is now a museum but was a hospital at the time of the battle of worcester ,
the commandery has been looking beautiful in the autumn sunshine !
# traveltuesday # worldclassworcs
@ twitterid
thank you : )

documents.title: worcester news front page : screams as cars burn
text: a `` shocked '' resident was awoken by his sister 's screams to find his car on fire yesterday morning .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: watch : dogs at risk because their chip details are not up-to-date
text: the dogs trust say dogs are at risk of being put down because the details on the microchip have not been updated .
the charity say more than 15,000 stray dogs were up last year - many of them were microchipped , but not with up-to-date information .
the results come from the organisation 's annual survey of local authorities , which also revealed 3,463 stray dogs had been destroyed in the last year .

documents.title: latest : ms hope in moscow ; sexual trauma therapy cuts fear ; memorial evening for murdered policeman
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in herefordshire and worcestershire :
- a kidderminster woman with multiple sclerosis says a treatment in russia could stop the condition in its tracks
- concern over possible cuts to therapy and counselling for sexual trauma victims
- memorial evening for herefordshire police officer who was murdered whilst serving in cyprus 60 years ago
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: concern over plans to cut therapy and counselling for sexual trauma victims
text: a worcestershire woman has hit out at plans to cut therapy and counselling for sexual trauma in the county .
at the end of this month , cathy - who was abused as a child - will lose the support she gets on the nhs , and could have to pay £ 60 to get the same privately .
she 's is worried the progress she 's made will be lost .
worcestershire county council says is yet to make a final decision on closing the county 's sexual health and counselling team .
it says it is working with providers to ensure services can continue .

documents.title: watch : moscow trip planned for ms treatment
text: a kidderminster woman is raising £ 40,000 in order to undergo treatment for multiple sclerosis in moscow because she 's been told she is n't ill enough to qualify for it on the nhs .
janet voyce was diagnosed last year in june with the nervous system condition and has so far raised £ 9,000 of the total she needs to get the treatment from a specialist clinic .
author: Felicity Sanderson
Journalist

documents.title: freemasons donate £ 2,500 to fund equipment for first responders
text: freemasons have donated £ 2,500 to their local community first responders to help them buy the most up-to-date defibrillators .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: drug deaths higher than the number of road fatalities
text: more people now die from illegal drugs in worcestershire than on the roads .
between 2013 and 2015 , 59 people died from misusing illegal drugs in worcestershire , and 19 in herefordshire .
the number of people dying because of illegal drugs in england and wales has now reached its highest level since records began .

documents.title: latest : ms treatment in moscow bid ; illegal drug deaths up ; tourism boom
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in herefordshire and worcestershire :
- a kidderminster woman is raising £ 40,000 in order to undergo treatment for multiple sclerosis in moscow
- more people now die from illegal drugs in worcestershire than on the roads
- tourism boom as the number of overnight stays in the region jump by 22 %
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: watch : weather for herefordshire and worcestershire
text: it 'll be a grey and damp start to the day for most with patchy light rain and drizzle .
by midday , it will be mainly dry , then brighter conditions will move in with some sunshine and it will feel pleasant .
highs of 20c ( 68f )
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from today 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on tuesday morning .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: the local live team is back from 08:00 with more news , sport , travel and weather , but keep an eye out here for breaking news during the evening and into the morning .
have a great evening .

documents.title: worcester baker in final of great vegan bake off
text: a baker from worcester has made it to the final of peta 's great vegan bake off contest .
natalie clince impressed judges with her triple-layered caramel shortbread .
now the public will help the judges decide whom out of the 12 finalists should be crowned the great vegan bake off champion .

documents.title: latest : teenager hit by car suffers serious head injury ; student becomes knife thrower 's assistant
text: here 's a recap of some of our top stories this afternoon :
- a teenager has suffered a serious head injury after he was hit by a car in the centre of hereford
- student is a circus knife thrower 's new assistant
- the dad of a worcestershire supermodel , who 's fronting a bbc hereford & worcester campaign about body confidence , says mechanisms for reporting online abuse are n't up to scratch

documents.title: midsomer murders dog to quit entertainment industry after more than a decade
text: a dog who 's starred in midsomer murders is to hang up his lead after more than a decade in the entertainment industry .
his trainer , ashley foster , from herefordshire , says he 's a happy and healthy dog but is getting older , slower and little bit deafer .

documents.title: teenager hit by car suffers serious head injury
text: a teenager has suffered a serious head injury after he was hit by a car in the centre of hereford in the early hours of sunday morning .
the 19-year-old was struck as he crossed bath street at 00:15 .
a 70-year-old woman who was driving was not hurt .
police are asking anybody who saw the collision , or the teenager at any time on saturday evening , to make contact .

documents.title: rural school budgets have 'little left '
text: worcestershire councillor fran oborski says the government is to blame for rural primary schools being forced to ask parents to help pay for basic equipment such as books .

headteachers have told bbc hereford and worcester that low numbers of new pupils , as well as additional costs like funding free school meals for infants , mean there 's little left in their budgets for anything other than staff salaries .
a fairer funding formula , which would ensure every school has the money to match its needs , does n't come into effect until 2018 .

documents.title: council rapped for financial errors
text: serious concerns raised about council finances have been addressed by an external auditor .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: worcestershire schools get £ 2,000 less per pupil than other areas
text: a worcestershire campaigner says the government needs to do more to ensure rural schools have enough money to pay for equipment such as books .
schools in the county are getting around £ 2,000 less per pupil than in other parts of the country .

a fairer funding formula , which will ensure every school has funding matched to its needs , is being introduced in 2018 , but fizz bewley , who is from the fair pupil funding campaign , says more needs to be done in the immediate term .

documents.title: your pictures : rainbow over malvern hills
text: there 's a pot of gold on top of the malvern hills .
thanks to toppo for sending in this beautiful taken in great malvern .
you can send us your using facebook , twitter , email or by joining bbc weather watchers .

documents.title: hereford fish and chip shop in final of national awards
text: a fish and chip shop in hereford is in the running to be named the best new fish and chip shop in the country .
edwards plaice is up against nine other shops in the category at this year 's national fish and chip awards .
three worcestershire shops are in the final 20 for the independent takeaway category - catchems end in bewdley , plus the golden carp and winyates chippy in redditch .

documents.title: drug user found dead in flat
text: a drug user who had gone clean in order to get custody of his son was found dead in his flat after taking a multiple drugs including 'street ' heroin .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: what have you always wanted to know about hereford & worcester ?
text: have you got a question about hereford & worcester ?
is there something you have seen or heard that you would like us to investigate ?
it could be a burning issue or something you have always wondered about the area or its people .
send us your questions here .
we could be in touch and your question could make the news .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: kohler-cadmore awarded for fastest ton
text: kohler-cadmore awarded for fastest ton

documents.title: worcestershire batsman wins trophy for fastest hundred of season
text: worcestershire batsman tom kohler-cadmore has won this year 's walter lawrence trophy for scoring the fastest hundred of the county cricket season .
he claimed the award for reaching a century in just 43 balls in worcestershire 's t20 blast match against durham jets .
it helped the rapids to reach 225-6 in their 20 overs to win the match by 38 runs .

documents.title: meet the knife-thrower 's new assistant
text: meet the knife-thrower 's new assistant

documents.title: charity trek across tanzania in tuk tuk
text: a herefordshire woman is spending six weeks trekking across tanzania - travelling 3,500 miles in a tuk tuk .
vanessa tesagus is raising money for local children 's homes and promoting the message women have a choice not to have fgm .

documents.title: your pictures : postcard views
text: the weather might be turning autumnal outside but the fields are still full of green .
thanks to mikesnapper for sending in this of lower broadheath in worcesterhshire .
you can send us your in on facebook , twitter , email or by joining bbc weather watchers .

documents.title: vegetable grower 's world record bid takes root
text: a grower of giant vegetables is in with a chance of holding three world records
joe atherton displayed his oversized produce at the weekend 's malvern autumn show and is waiting for confirmation from guinness world records that he has the longest carrot , beetroot and radish .
the vegetables measured 6.245m , 7.956m and 5.023m .

documents.title: your comments : are smart motorways safe ?
text: a project to turn part of the m5 through worcestershire into a smart motorway is expected to be finished early next year .
however , a poll by the aa has found that eight out of 10 drivers think the removal of permanent hard shoulders has made motorways more unsafe .
you 've been posting your thoughts on the bbc hereford and worcester facebook page .
gordon boldezi thinks it is a bad idea : `` there is an accident in the m5 roadworks nearly every day , it 's the most dangerous motorway in britain at the moment .
the lanes are ridiculously narrow , saw two lorries actually touch each other . ''
emma canning is also critical : `` it 's a stupid idea and will cause a crash .
also block emergency services getting past . ''
however , richard johnson thinks it is a good idea : `` they do work if people use them correctly and not lane hog when soft shoulder is an open lane . ''

documents.title: low pupil numbers pushing school 'into deficit '
text: a worcestershire primary school says low pupil numbers and unfunded government policies are pushing it into deficit .
clifton on teme primary school has room for 105 pupils , but this year has only 66 .
that means it 's missing out on tens of thousands of pounds .
this year the school also has to cover the cost of free meals for all infants , as government grants are no longer available .

documents.title: abandoned 'grumpy ' cat rescued by worcestershire woman
text: meet hodor , a cat abandoned in spain who had to have his fur shaved off because of a nasty skin disease .
he has been taken in by a redditch woman who now lives on the continent .
lucy ware , who lives near malaga , said she could not resist his `` grumpy old man '' looks when she spotted a campaign seeking a new owner .

documents.title: smart motorways unsafe according to aa poll
text: work is still taking place on the m5 between junction 4a and junction 6 to create the first smart motorway in worcestershire .
it will allow the hard shoulder to be used as a fourth lane during busy periods .
but the aa says drivers do n't want hard shoulders to go , as there are n't enough places for drivers to stop in an emergency .
its poll found that eight out of 10 drivers thought the removal of permanent hard shoulders had made motorways more unsafe than four years ago .

documents.title: project for people living with dementia to be extended
text: more worcestershire residents living with dementia and their carers are to benefit from a project to help them relive their memories from the 40s , 50s and 60s using the art of storytelling .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: travel : all lanes open again on m42 northbound
text: all lanes are now open on the m42 northbound .
between j2 a441 and j3 a435 , following an earlier accident .
all lanes open again # m42 n/b j2 # redditch to j3 # birmingham after the collision and overturned car .
long delays remain from jcn with # m5 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: father of plus-size model hides sinister abuse
text: the father of plus-size model iskra lawrence has revealed the sinister online abuse he 's been hiding from her , during filming for the bbc .
doug lawrence showed his 26-year-old daughter a video where a man dressed as the joker says `` i will kill you '' .
miss lawrence , from kidderminster , worcestershire , has long been the subject of internet trolling .
you can see this story in full on bbc inside out west midlands at 19:30 on bbc one , or via iplayer for 30 days afterwards .

documents.title: vegetable grower breaks world record
text: a vegetable grower has claimed a world record for the size of his red cabbage at this weekend 's malvern autumn show .
david thomas 's vegetable weighed in at 23 kilograms in the national giant vegetable championships .
other world records claimed to have been broken are for a carrot that 's more than six metres long , the longest beetroot and a parsnip that 's five metres in length .
none of the records have yet been verified .

documents.title: severe disruption : m42 worcestershire southbound
text: there are still long delays and queuing traffic due to accident on the m42 northbound between j2 a441 .
and j3 a435 , congestion on m42 to j1 a38 .
1 lane now open again # m42 n/b btwn j2 # redditch and j3 # birmingham .
2 lanes closed to enable @ twitterid @ twitterid to work at scene .
author: BBC Travel

text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- a worcestershire primary school says low pupil numbers and unfunded government policies are pushing it into deficit
- a worcester lawyer accused of attempted murder is due in nottingham crown court this morning
- the former labour mp for worcester , mike foster , says the party can put on a united front now jeremy corbyn has been confirmed as leader
